result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:59 PM Defendant Forrest H Mckee in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Forrest H Mckee.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading. Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

11:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Forrest H Mckee in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Forrest H Mckee.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes she's been provided a written waiver of prelim.  Atty Masana states the DE will waive his right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Masana requests ARGN be set out and possible plea/sent.  Court notes if it's a felony resolution that a Monday would be preferable.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Forrest H Mckee in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Forrest H Mckee. Atty Masana advises matter is not resolved.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Return date on June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:30 PM Defendant Forrest H Mckee in court with attorney Allison A Markoski.  Defendant Forrest H Mckee in custody.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Forrest H Mckee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE has new address and that is provided.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests $250 cash w/conditions.  Atty Markoski responds - requests signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
